model_hint: Use face reference with strength ~0.80 to maintain consistent plain average appearance, young 15-year-old features, short black hair, and expressive eyes that change with emotion. Avoid distinctive features.
design_notes: The protagonist's face is intentionally plain and forgettable, allowing player identification and projection. The eyes are the primary vehicle for emotional and psychological expression. Initial Year 1 expressions capture the anxiety, confusion, and emerging determination of a new technical college student.

design_philosophy.plainness_rationale: The protagonist's intentional plainness serves three purposes: (1) Player projection - plain features allow players to see themselves; (2) Contrast enhancement - when compared to distinctive heroines (Mai, Ai, Mina, Yuzu), the protagonist's ordinariness highlights their flexibility and adaptability; (3) Growth visibility - transformation from Year 1 to Year 5 becomes most dramatic when starting from unadorned baseline
design_philosophy.eyes_as_primary_vehicle: Eyes carry 80% of emotional communication. Initial unfocused/anxious eyes evolve to sharp/determined/compassionate eyes depending on player choices and route taken
design_philosophy.face_aging_importance: The 5-year journey from 15 to 20 years old must be visually evident. Year 1 should show clear adolescent softness; Year 5 should show young adult maturity. This aging progression is crucial for time passage realism.
design_philosophy.consistency_strategy: All Year 1 expressions use single reference image (Player_Neutral.png) with varying denoising strengths to maintain continuity while allowing emotion variation
